steps.title: Database Auto-Connection
steps.content: When you run the app, the datasource plugin will check for a database in your runner. If one exists, it will be automatically connected.

steps.title: Discover the Datasource
steps.content: Open on Datasource Explorer panel and select Runner-DS-spring-petclinic-... to browse the connected database

steps.title: Explore the Database
steps.content: Explore the database’s tables and schema. We’ve opened the requests.sql file for you - you’ll use it in the next step to make a change.

steps.title: Create SQL Request
steps.content:
In requests.sql add a request to get all entries from the Pets SQL table. Add the following line to the end of the file: select * from petclinic.pets order by id desc;
You can use ‘ctrl+space’ to get syntax-completion on SQL statements. Save the file when you’re done.

steps.title: Execute SQL Request
steps.content: Hit “Execute” to process your request and see the pet names in “Query Results” section.

steps.title: Try Your Own Database
steps.content: You can add your own database by adding it to a Docker container (our docs discuss how to create custom Docker environments).  You will need a Codenvy account to do this - sign-up if you haven’t already to save your database.
